content.html:
Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. The graph of function \(H\) shows the height, in meters, of a rocket \(t\) seconds after it was launched.
    1. Find \(H(0)\) in meters.

Enter Answer Here: Enter Only Integers

Correct! 15 meters, This is the height that the rocket was launched.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.3. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 15 meters. This is the height that the rocket was launched. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

    1. Which of the following describes the domain of this function?

Correct! \(0≤x≤4.5\).; The domain includes all values from 0 to approximately 4.5, 0≤x≤4.5.

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 4.12.2-4.12.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 4.5, 0≤x≤4.5. The domain includes all values from 0 to approximately 4.5, \(0≤x≤4.5\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

    1. Which of the following describes the range of this function?

Correct! \(0\leq y\leq35\); The range includes all values from 0 to 35 meters, \(0\leq y\leq35\).

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 4.12.2-4.12.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(0\leq y\leq35\); \(0≤x≤4.5\). The range includes all values from 0 to 35 meters, \(0\leq y\leq35\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which of the following describes the domain of the function graphed below?

Correct! \(2≤x≤7\); The domain is all values from at least 2 to a maximum of 7, \(2≤x≤7\).

: Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.12.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(2≤x≤7\); the domain is all values from at least 2 to a maximum of 7, \(2≤x≤7\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which of the following describes the range of the graph below?

Correct! \(2≤y≤4\); The range is all values from at least 2 to a maximum of 4, \(2≤y≤4\).

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is 2≤y≤4. The range is all values from at least 2 to a maximum of 4, 2≤y≤4. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Select all of the values of the range for the function \(h\), graphed below.

Correct! -3, -2, 2, 4

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.12.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answers are -3, -2, 2, 4. You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which of the following is the domain of the function graphed below?

Correct! \(-5≤x≤5\)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(-5≤x≤5\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which of the following represents the domain of the function graphed below?

Correct! \(x≥2\)

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activity 4.12.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is \(x≥2\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?

  1. Which of the following represents the range of the function graphed below?

Correct! \(y \geq 5 \)

Try again. Work smarter, not harder! Take a moment to think about what you learned in activity 4.12.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is \(y≥5\). You seem to be stuck. Who can you ask for help?
